instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
water damage near UF400 clean all the area and replaced some damaged components and replaced UF400
5V 0.2A for 3sec and then 0.04A ppbus of F5200 12.3v pulsing. didnt see any short..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> appears?
Check for pulse/short on master/slave LDOs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> - 3.8V
all LDO pulsing but no short..
<SIGNAL>USBC0_3V3LDO_EN_MUX</SIGNAL> 0V no short
<SIGNAL>USBC1_3V3LDO_EN</SIGNAL> 0v no short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
PPBUS/<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> pulsing, or stable?
Master/slave LDOs on pages 28 & 33.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
PPBUS 12.3v-8v pulsing
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> 3.8v stable
LDO Master:
<SIGNAL>PP1V4_LDO_PREREG</SIGNAL> 1.4v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_VLDOINT_MPMU</SIGNAL> 1.5V stable
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2</SIGNAL> 1.2v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S2_UPC</SIGNAL> 3.3V pulsing
PP1V8_AON_ PMU 1.8v stable.

LDO Slave:
<SIGNAL>PPVDD_PMU_LDO_PREREG</SIGNAL> 1.4v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP0V855_S2SW_CIO</SIGNAL> 0.8v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP1V25_AWAKESW_VCCQ</SIGNAL> 1.2v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP0V72_S2_VDD_LOW</SIGNAL> 0.7v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP0V805_S1_VDD_FIXED</SIGNAL> 0.8v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE_PLL</SIGNAL> 1.2v pulsing
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AON_SPMU</SIGNAL> 1.8v stable
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S2_CIO</SIGNAL> 1.2v pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v ppbus pulsing.
threads.message:
Something else affected by corrosion on the MLB.
Check diode mode to ground on all coils.

threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V8_S2</SIGNAL> 0.0473 no full short, cant find from where the short. and im afraid to inject voltage

threads.message: You should compare the reading with working board...
